fields.symptoms: Angry. Want to stay angry. It's a feeling that feels good to have, and I want to be more mad.
fields.name: Anger
fields.cause: A thorn.  See below.
fields.helpful:
The examples I have for dealing with anger (mom, dad) aren't particularly good.  I'll have to find a good way to deal with it.  
The bike ride, having a beer, and unwinding a bit helped.  
Talking to Jeff helped.

Try this:
Do some really hard physical activity.  Seriously push yourself, hard. Rant. Be pissed and cursing. Turn that anger into physical motion. Once you get past there, you'll eventually burn off the anger, and find yourself in a quiet place.
Then, find the thorn. Something, maybe a few things, started this.  Figure out what they are, and then carry them back to the situation and address them.

The first exertion won't always be enough. Keep going back until you get there.
Not-angry you knows how good it can feel, but also knows that there are a lot of other good things here you can't get to from that place.  Like loved. And happy. And smiling. Come back when you're done. :)
----
Do physical stuff until you get it out.
Rest.
Let yourself express what's bothering you, the thorn that's causing the rage.
You may have to repeat the above a few times. Don't worry, it will come, and you'll feel better.

Trust your real gut on when to act. If it feels iffy, wait. :)  You'll always be able to address it later.

fields.symptoms:
Constant hamster-wheel running in the mind
Keep thinking the same thoughts over and over
Physical stress
Nervous movement
fields.name: Anxiety
fields.one_liner: When I'm anxious, my mind won't stop running, usually over something that is in the future I'm waiting on. I get physically tense, too.
fields.cause:
Fairly rare, but largely about big things coming in the future that I can't control or do anything about.
Movies hit this button.
fields.helpful:
Work out.  It helps a TON.  Gives a place to put all that energy, and gives us great results to boot!
Look around, in the moment.  Feel the air moving over you. Watch the leaves.  Pull back your view, see the wider world that you're in. You're not surrounded entirely by the problem - it's just one part of a bigger world.  Let it be that.

fields.symptoms:
Focusing on some big goal at the expense of my life.  Note that focusing on big things is fine, and good, in fact.

The key is to approach them in healthy ways.  Me going off, alone, to take on the Big Problem is not healthy. Me working hard, focusing my talents to work with people on Big Problems is healthy.  That's the one we want.

Key symptom: is anyone else working on this?
fields.name: Being a Martyr / Going it alone
fields.cause:
It's a story that was told for most of my life.  Save the world.  Sacrifice my happiness, goals, and enjoyment for the greater good. 

It comes from my mom - who's always trying to play the martyr to get attention, love, or acceptance.

Sometimes, the behavior also comes from a fear that if I get other people involved, they'll ruin my idea and/or a fear that my idea isn't in fact that good.
fields.helpful:
Pause, look with honesty at my intents.  See why i'm doing something.
Remember that I get to choose the stories I'm telling. Being a martyr isn't one I'm interested in telling at the moment.
Bring in other people.  It's scary, but it can be really helpful. Diversity of thought can really help an idea, and will almost always help it be executed.

fields.symptoms:
Mind running a million miles an hour
Unable to think clearly
Sudden action without thought
fields.name: Claustrophobic
fields.cause:
Being in a physically really small space (less common)
Being in an action-constrained space
fields.helpful:
Breathing.  
This might be a severe sort of anxiety. The stuff for it might work well.

fields.symptoms:
Absolute paralysis.  Inability to choose, stalling for time.
Totally blank mind.
No clear answer.
fields.name: Conflicted
fields.cause: Having to choose between two or more choices that all carry emotional investment and feeling like either choice will let someone down.
fields.helpful:
Do the best I can to lay out the options logically and emotionally.  If there's a slight edge to one, pick it.
If there's no edge, flip a coin.
This will seem really harsh in that moment, but the reality is that the most important thing you can do is make the decision, and then work to help mitigate the consequences for the party that wasn't chosen.
Stalling and leaving folks hanging does more harm than saying "no", since they can then move on and plan for a contingency.
It'll be ok. Everyone still loves you, and they will continue to.  It's ok to say no, and it won't change that. :)  Hug. :)

fields.symptoms:
Feel really down.
Thoughts of suicide.
Rarely, mentally beating myself up.
Lethargic, not interested in doing things.
Evasive/elusive.
Drinking increases.
fields.name: Depression
fields.one_liner: Sometimes, I get depressed. I feel really sad and have self-harming thoughts.
fields.cause:
Hunger
Worry
Lack of money
Losing someone's love
Feeling not good enough
Anxiety can trigger this
Dental work and/or tooth pain
fields.helpful:
Step 0: Good job, you noticed!  Seriously, that's huge.  It takes a while to notice, and doing just that got us a lot of the way to better.  Things will get better. Make sure to stay present, and watch what you're doing, openly. You've gone through it before, and you've made it to the other side.  You'll get there.

Step 1: Get to a better place.
Distraction - read a book/story, play a game, watch some tv or sports.
Sit, smile, listen to warm music (like Of Monsters and Men), let the real me hug me through it
Write.

Step 2:
Identify the root cause. Keep digging, don't stop at easy answers.

Step 3:
Address the actual problem.  If nothing can be done at the moment, identify coping mechanisms, and a long-term fix for the solution (with an actual timeline.)



Dental:
Know and plan for this when dental appointments happen. Schedule in some good cuddling and love those days.

fields.name: Exposed to new ideas
fields.one_liner: I was exposed to new, mind-changing ideas today.
fields.cause: I respond slowly to new ideas. It takes me a few days to really process them, despite my immediate response at the time.
fields.helpful: I need to identify when they're new, and acknowledge that I'm going to need to think on it for a few days.

fields.name: Freedom
fields.cause: Being completely honest, putting all my thoughts and worries out there.

fields.symptoms:
Starts by me rushing through tasks - just forcing my way through by sheer force of will.  Corners get cut, things get broken. 
Anger.  Lashing out at anyone or anything that's attempting to ask anything of me (ex. Tomo, food)
fields.name: Frustration
fields.cause:
Multiple competing demands on my time, not enough resources/time to do them all.
Sometimes, this is because I've overbooked.
Sometimes, it's because something just went wrong due to no fault at all.
fields.helpful:
Cancel one of the demands. Just call it in, cross it off, and say no. 
Keep canceling until the stress falls.  You're good at prioritization, you'll pick the right one.
Just say no to one of the things, and let it go.  Everything will be ok.

fields.symptoms:
Strong emotions, anger, frustration.
Inability to think clearly.
Indecision.
fields.name: Hangry
fields.one_liner: When I'm hungry, I'm much more prone to frustration/anger.
fields.cause: Need food. Low blood sugar.
fields.helpful:
Eat food!
If I can't get food immediately, short-term, recognize that that's what's happening, make a plan to get food, and try to finish whatever I'm doing with presence, and awareness that the emotions I'm feeling are mostly food-ish.

fields.symptoms:
Worrying about someone, particularly a partner up and leaving because they don't love me
Writing off that worry as dumb (not helpful)
fields.name: Insecure
fields.one_liner: I feel insecure about being loved.
fields.cause:
Root cause: probably my childhood.
Situational causes: 
expressing love to someone, not hearing anything back.
fields.helpful:
Expressing that insecurity directly
Being aware of it as an emotion
Finding talismans that say "you are loved"

Trying the plan for the worst, move forward believing the best.  It helped uncover inconsistencies in the worry, but I'm not entirely sure it made me feel better.  At least it didn't the next day.

fields.symptoms:
Off budget.
Making excuses and explanations of why this month doesn't count.
Mentally dismissing that it's not a big deal.
fields.name: Irresponsible Finances
fields.cause:
Stress, a need to feel in control can cause buying.
Depression will cause buying random things that I hope make me happy (not conscious, but happens)
fields.helpful:
Keep it tangible.  Real paper, real transactions, a real calculator to add things up.
Make a habit of it. Keep the paper budget, stick to crossing things off.
Positive reinforcement. Build in rewards, and visualize the progress towards reaching the goal.  Celebrate that progress, both to myself, and socially.

fields.symptoms: Mind starts running, thinking up the worst possible outcomes, making responses for them, and sometimes, dwelling / wallowing in them.
fields.name: Left in the Dark
fields.one_liner: I don't know what's going on. My mind runs to find the worst.
fields.cause: There's information out there about some future unknown that affects me.  Someone else knows it, but because of the situation, I can't (or feel I can't) ask for more information.
fields.helpful:
Am I actually (intent?) being left in the dark?
- If yes: confront the person/issue, or leave the situation entirely.  It's probably not healthy.
- If no: try to let it go, or set up a time to get information. Taking steps helps. Communicating with the person(s) who are keeping me in the dark can help. 

Trying some of the pessimism (plan, then focus on the good) strategies may also help.

fields.name: lonely
fields.one_liner: I do need to hang out with people.  I'm an introvert, but I still need my people time.
fields.helpful: Make time to go see friends.

fields.symptoms:
Not looking at a light switch when I turn it off.
Not looking at things in the kitchen as I move around.
Moving quickly, not thinking about what I'm doing.
Bumping into things.
fields.name: Not being present
fields.cause:
Sometimes, it's just super efficiency, and that's probably cool
Sometimes it's too much to do, and rushing past things to get to the future things.
fields.helpful:
"Look full-on"
Stop and listen to the sounds around me.
Seven vows.
Feel free to take off future burdens if it's a too much to do issue.
Schedule / say no / plan so that I only have one thing to do. (even having only one thing for a given time period helps.)
Exercise.  Oddly, it helps.
Sit still long enough to notice where you are.
Listen.  Listen until you're _here_, _now_.

Longer-term: 
Develop habits (meditation, mantras you see often) that help shape presence in the moment.

fields.symptoms: This is where frustration, and lack of presence show up.
fields.name: Overcommitted
fields.one_liner: Too much to do, not enough time/resources.
fields.cause: Too much to do, not enough time/resources.
fields.helpful:
Dequeue things I'm mentally tracking, and put them onto a list.
Say no to things. Cut back on responsibilities.

fields.symptoms: Squirrel-mind running through all the worst-case scenarios.  Brings down my mood, triggers depression. May cause self-fulfillment of the bad.
fields.name: Pessimism
fields.one_liner: Something's coming, and I dwell on the worst-case situation. Might create a self-fulfilling prophecy.
fields.cause: It's a habit. The cue is some future unknown, with "good" and "bad" outcomes.
fields.helpful:
Make a plan for the bad, then focus my thoughts and energy on the good.
Self-fulfill the prophecy of the "good" result.
Realize "good" and "bad" have quotes may help.

fields.symptoms: Acting without thought or presence, to try to satisfy someone's perceived needs.
fields.name: Pleaser
fields.cause: Insecurity, worry about losing something
fields.helpful:
Realizing it's happening is a huge part of it.
Get some space, try to be present with yourself, 
then look at the problem.  

There's likely a better solution at hand, or at least, a more true one.

fields.symptoms:
My weight, body fat % go up.
I'm not working out consistently, or otherwise getting activity
I'm not eating good, healthy food.
I'm drinking more than normal.
I haven't had a doctor checkup.
Not brushing my teeth.
fields.name: Poor Health
fields.cause:
Stress, lack of space can make me make excuses or not feel like being active.
Being really busy, and having it be a lower priority than other things on my plate.
Self-consciousness. To really push myself, working out is a solitary activity. That's ok.  If I feel pulled into group / forced dynamics, I tend to make excuses and leave.
fields.helpful:
Consistent reinforcement, and building habits.
Make time to work out, at least 15 minutes, every other day.
Keep up monthly massages to stay accountable.
Take advantage of weekends to do enjoyable things that are still active.
Listen to my body.
Prioritize it - I only have one body. If it's because I'm too busy, let some of those obligations go to make time and room for this.
Habits are probably the most helpful here.  I'm a good creature of habit, good or bad.  Keeping an eye on these, good or bad is great.
Having a monthly health review could be great.

fields.symptoms:
It's really hard for me to identify it in the moment right now.  There will be a twinge of "oh shit", and then the habit takes over. My emotions turn off, and I talk my way out of the situation, to resolve it in a good way.

Later (could be days), when I feel safe, the emotion of the experience will come in, full-force. It's only then that I'll feel scared, sad, hurt, whatever the real emotions of that experience were.
fields.name: Scared / Surprised
fields.one_liner: I either fight or shut down and talk my way out of it.
fields.cause:
Sudden intense experiences, particularly if there's a possible negative outcome.

Talk my way out of it habit comes from childhood - playing, mom comes in screaming, talk her down. Emotionally shut off in cases of stress.
fields.helpful:
In the context of a relationship, as much as possible, plan ahead and avoid this response. A little heads up of "I'd like to talk about some emotional stuff at some point, if you can be emotionally available for that" can/may help me be present.  

Finding a way to diffuse and take the pressure off the situation. 
Reassurances that everything will be ok, I'm loved, wanted, whatever my concern is in the situation.

--- 
Original phrasing:
"i want to talk to you about some big life stuff. Can we make a time to have an emotionally open communication, and then follow up a few days later?"

I'm going to have stuff come up, and react emotionally days later written i feel safe to be emotional. Need to be able to communicate then and not bottle it up.

Long term, to be able to be emotional I'm those conversations. Need security and safety and assurance of love to do that  and some practice.

----
It's not all my fault,
And i am good enough. :)

fields.symptoms:
Not being silly/weird, behaving how I think I'm expected to behave.
Not owning the space I occupy.
fields.name: Silly
fields.cause: Worrying about what other people thing.
fields.helpful:
YOLO. Just be yourself.
Keep your inner nar.

fields.symptoms:
General malaise.  Unhappy, unable to say why, not enjoying little moments.
If you don't enjoy going for a walk with your relationship partner, you don't have enough space.
Picking random things to get picky about.

This is really a tough one to spot.  It's subtle, and pretty hidden from my view when it's happening. The only way I notice is when I *do* finally get enough space, and realize it was gone.

<x hours of alone time a week is probably a good warning point.  Need data on when that actually is.
fields.name: Space
fields.cause:
Not going outside, seeing people, getting a wider view.
Not getting alone time. Just me, ideally without deadlines.
Not getting time to think, feel, be.
Not getting meditation time in the AM
Not feeling like there's a physical space I can call my own.
fields.helpful:
Need a lot of it.
Having a place with a view, the ability to see outside my walls and life.
Get into nature.
Walk around the city.
Hike.  Mountain bike.
Roast coffee (great thinking time)
Go somewhere without people, or without people that I feel are eyes on me. 
Go for a drive.  
Most of all, get out of human contact entirely.
Travel: it is important that I travel, maybe alone, fairly often. at least once a year. I need the space and perspective.
Have genuine space, possibly alone, with nothing to do but be in the moment, and nowhere to be immediately afterwards.


Tracking how much alone time I have is a good start on how to notice before it's a problem. Other ideas are very welcome.

fields.symptoms:
I'm snacking.  I'm not a snacker, actually.  But I do fall back to food and drinking to cope with general unhappiness, and it's an old habit.  Noticing at that point can be helpful.
Buying things. I do this, in the hope that it helps. I can't actually remember a time it did, though.  Maybe for something really cool, I got excited for it to come, or help redefine who I was through my stuff.
fields.name: Unhappy
fields.one_liner: Sometimes, I just don't feel happy.
fields.cause: Usually, if I dig into it, it's a combination of the other downers (anxiety, depression, doubt, etc).
fields.helpful:
If it's serious, it'll likely show itself as one of the others.  If it's lighter or more complex, it'll just be this vauge unhappy feeling with no reason.
Catching the habits, and then doing helpful things helps. 
Exercise helps.
Working on creative projects helps.
Finding out the root cause, and addressing it (see depression) helps.

Know that this will pass. :) 
Take note of what's happening around you, and record it, so we can make bumpers to help, and learn patterns to recover!  (Yes, I know that sounds über enthusiastic and obnoxious. But, it is seriously helpful, and we both know it.)

fields.symptoms:
Stays on todo list, keeps cycling through
Feel a barrier to doing it
When exercising, a barrier to get started, as well as feeling tired the first 10 minutes.
fields.name: Unmotivated
fields.one_liner: Sometimes, I'm not motivated to do something, even though I know it needs done, and i'll be happy I did it.
fields.cause:
Process is not fun (compost, taking stuff that I don't want neighbors to judge on to/from storage)
Task seems too big/daunting
Task seems like it's pointless
Feel like I'm not getting anywere
Seems hard (exercise).
fields.helpful:
Poms are a really useful tool for this.
Also, finding an associated task that I want to do to get something, and pairing them.
Exercise: To get started: pump up the music. Get moving.  
To push through the first 10: know it's a first 10 minutes thing, keep remembering that, and you'll be able to push past it.  
To keep going: zone in, and don't get distracted.  Focus on what you're doing, and you'll be set.

Earlier:
The deciding factor is if you want to go on the journey - if it's interesting enough to spend a lot of your life's time on.

fields.explanation:
Old stories:
- I drink because it's fun
- I drink so I can sleep
- I drink because it lowers my social inhibitions
- I drink to numb pain
- I drink because I'm stressed
- I drink because I'm anxious
- I drink because I'm bored (rarely)
- I drink because I like the taste
- I drink because I enjoy drinking liquids of any kind.


New stories:
- I drink because I like the taste
- I drink because it's fun


Tactics:
- Separate beers at home out of packages, make them discrete entities.
- Keep track of when (bumpers are doing this)
- Notice triggers, redirect, write them down.
fields.name: Drinking (Alcohol)

fields.explanation:

Old routines/ triggers
- Drink until sleepy (feeling drunk+environment = trigger)
- Strong bad videos 
- NFL videos
- White noise (fan)
- LOTR
- Top Gear (did not work in bed)

I am shaping a set of habits that will let me sleep when and where I want.  Thus goes the new story.

Current habit:
- alarm
- lights off
- ac
- blinds
- brush teeth
- set up ipad 
- sleep
fields.name: Sleep

fields.explanation:
So, where to now?
You don't have to have a grand life plan, but having a 5 years from now, or even 2 years from now goal's pretty good.

So, how about this?

Two years: Summer 2014.

Left W+K.  Working at a job that makes the world better, for good pay, with cool people.  Think Method or Nest or Solid Waste Engineering.
CC's paid off.  Emergency fund up to 3 full month's salary.  Student loans dropping at a steady clip.
If with Bon, either a kid's on the way, or it's on the way soon.  Probably want to coordinate that with the job, somehow.
If with Bon, our relationship and communication are kick-ass.
If not with Bon, healed up from Bon, hopefully (emotions will take their own time.) Looking into actually seriously dating someone.
Making things that interest me, whether it's furniture or online projects or quesadillas. 
Have a garden. Friends with the plants.
Active. In shape.
Developed coping mechanisms for trigger frustration situations (tight time, things aren't in my most efficient way.  doing something, being nagged for attention.  multiple competing demands on my attention. )
Still not glancing.  Still looking full-on.


Five years: Summer 2017.

Have lived in another country for a year.
Student loans paid off.
There is a place called home.
Healthy. In shape.
I wake up, proud of what I'm going to do today, and sure the world will be a bit better for it.
I understand a few more of these Seasons of Steven (summer, dry and artless, fall, winter.) I see things coming, watch myself change.
I keep my mid-life crisis on the horizon. Have a coping and support mechanisms in place to handle it.
Still not glancing.  Still full-on.



Debt:
Better to put $ in 401K or take on larger loans? Figure out with Bonnie.

Lots of crying and feeling sad this morning - Bon doc, pasting them below.

Ouch.  It all unravels and hits me at once.  I feel like some sort of transaction, some "good enough" plan. There's never been one moment, not one in this entire thing when she's looked at me and had excitement or joy and said, "I can't wait to start a life with you" or "I want you to be the father of my kids" or "we're gonna be great parents."  I feel like I'm plan b.  And I want to be wanted.  I want someone to be enthused and excited about starting a life with me.  To feel as lucky as I do.  And I've got none of that.
Intellectually, I understand, because it's complicated, but also I feel like there should have been at least one moment, just one, where she was excited, and looked at me with joy and optimism - and I can't find one.  Emotionally, this hurts a lot, and I wonder if it's what she really wants, if it's a good idea, if she actually has any of those feelings. This feeling sucks.

(Some of it comes from watching her publicly mourn on facebook, and that's like a knife to the heart, and I'm not allowed to do anything about it or say anything at all. Fuck, that hurts.)

Not sure what to do about it. I'd like to talk to her, to actually be able to communicate about this stuff, but we're in this fucking "no communication" period of time, which from my current perspective, seems like a totally fucked up way to start building a relationship where we want to have good communication.  WTF.

And I have a terrible headache from not enough sleep and too much crying. That's not helping.
Not sure what to do about it at this point, I guess go to work, and trust that things will eventually work out.

It's also hard with the job stuff because I want her input - it's a decision that has big implications on our life, and I can't.  And with the debt stuff, it just seems unfair and

All the questions and the marry-into-debt-stuff just hit me and man, that hurts.  It's like I'm just a series of checkboxes, and not quite good enough for what she wants but the best option she's got, so she'll take it.
Where's the person who wants me?  Who thinks I'm great, and who wants to start a life with me? Does she exist?
I've spent all this time trying to show her that I'm up for it, that I'm ready for the challenge and the joy, and in return, all I've gotten is a "you'll probably do. if you fix this and this and this about yourself and life to my standards." This fucking sucks.

I want wanted.  I hope somewhere, it's there.

---

Emotional:  Watching her publicly mourn in front of her friends and not being able to do anything is torture, shitty, and unfair.  It's made more sharply painful by the thought that I don't think if she'd decided the other way, she'd be doing this at all.  She would have just moved forward.  I don't think (other than what's inferred by her actions) I have a real view or feel for her emotions toward me. I need to.

Maybe we need to take some space, some real space, and then start from somewhere mutual.  For her to totally get over Charlie, and be able to come in from a place where she can actually emotionally engage with me.  This foundation needs to be build on trust, and respect, and love and communication.  If the love and want and I-think-you're-amazing isn't there, it won't work. It needs to be.

So maybe that's it. We take space, and move forward with our lives, and see what's there when the dust settles.  I know that where I am right now isn't a place to start. 

Heading to work:
"Moving forward. If have to adopt a kid and be a single father, i will."


Lunch:
Never. Not once. Not for one moment was there the excitement of "I want to start a life with you" or "I think you're going to be a great dad". And that fucking sucks.  And if that's not true, if those emotions aren't really there, then maybe she should go with Charlie.  I want to start a life with someone who's excited to be with me, excited for the things we can do and share together - not just someone for whom I check all the necessary boxes. 

If she's not there, I'm not sure any of this is a good idea.  If she is there, she's got to figure out a way to communicate that in a way I can feel.
---
Feel like I want to act.  Drive out there, and talk. What I should do is get a full night's sleep, wait a day or two, and see if that's still how I feel.

fields.healthy_drinking_notes:
Big, big gains here.  Actively pushed away a drink at one point because I was feeling anxious.
Brought my sleep drinking down from 3ish to 1ish beers a night. That rocks.  The sleep routine-habit totally works!
Generally not drinking because I'm stressed, depressed, or anxious.  Win.

Every. Other. Day.

fields.closer_to_two_year_plan_notes: Made progress on every point except the job. (and the garden - though I did get new Iris friens!)
fields.sex_life_is_good_notes:
Started the off- health, fun, respectful, I-am-beautiful-when-I-come sort of masturbation.
I haven't been staying on it every day, and I'm not quite to the "can't wait to do this" point, but progress is being made.
Maybe recording how long it takes could help me speed up, and having 'speed' days and 'slow' days?
Turning this into something where I get another reward besides the orgasm might be a great idea.

Not in a relationship or with anyone, so right now, me's the one I've got.
Am feeling healthy, good, and not guilty or dirty about it.  Progress is being made. :)
fields.making_the_world_a_bit_better_notes:
P&G Cold water's a biggie, and the Nike Women's marathon was good.
Also got to facilitate a few workshops, which felt good, and go to the reading, which was amazing.  I definitely helped the woman who got out of an abusive relationship's life.
Would like to be doing a bit more, or working at a better place.
Pushing on working on more W+K tomorrow stuff, that seems like a good path at W+K for now.
fields.enough_time_alone_notes: Tons of alone time, feel like I've got plenty of space.
fields.getting_out_enough_notes:

Working on-site at W+K, so I get out during the week, and getting out to bike or move on the weekend, so I'm generally out those days too.
fields.what_is_the_work_story_i_am_telling: I'm creative, an alpha, don't give a shit, and bitch about too many meetings, am generally dissatisfied with the quality of work and people I work with.  Pay's good.  Challenges are good.
fields.presence_notes: Man, has presence really helped this month.  It's not 100% all the time, but it's helping pull me out of habits and into healthier behaviors. Gutterbumpers are setting up habits, and it's been contagious - I notice myself doing things even at work now.  Presence is a great, great thing. :)

Sleep routine
No drinking when anxious
When anxious, work out
When a big future unknown looms, analyze and plan for the worst, the focus emotionally on the best
fields.have_a_space_that_is_just_mine_notes:
Indigo.  This is a really good place for me on the space front.
Also have the studio, but haven't gone there.
fields.what_is_the_relationship_story_i_am_tell:
Open, hopeful, and respecting her space.
Believe we have trust, respect, love and ok communication. 3 out of 4.  Communication could be great, and I very much want to start and grow a life with Bonnie.  An extraordinary life, where we have amazing kids, travel, experience the world, grow, change, and leave a better world and footprints. :)

fields.making_things_notes: Made gutterbumpers, and a few little things at work, but not a lot of making, honestly.  It's summer, so I'll chalk it up to that.  For reference, I don't feel like I'm missing making things, or that I don't have enough time - I just don't have strong motivations. The thing I've really been making is me.
fields.in_touch_with_spirtuality_notes:
I touch this every day when I meditate, and I feel generally aware.
This month is when I went through all of my religious/spiritual things, kept some, and let some go.  Came to the realization that I am a spiritual person, animate, feel a living world around me, and talk to trees.  This is me, this is good. :)
It's not the stuff I carry - they're just reminders of that connection.
Letting the broken staff go was hard, but still feels right.  She should return to the circle, and I should move forward, keeping the reverence, but using healing, not pain, as a motivator.
fields.healthy_eating_notes:
Rocked it. 
Found a rhythm, eating when I'm hungry.

Trying the post-workout protein loading, to put on muscle, and it works - I gain weight, and lose body fat.
fields.happiness_notes: Overall, big progress, but pretty up and down with the Bonnie uncertainty.  Being present has helped me actively change attitude several times though, which has been great.

fields.healthy_drinking_notes:
Pretty good. The sleep routine has really changed things.  I'm still having a couple of beers a night to unwind while I read comics, but I a) think that's probably ok, and b) think that's probably changeable if I wanted. 

Not drinking super-good beer (being cost conscious), but am buying the stuff I like.

Occasionally slip into the "one more beer so I can sleep" habit.  Need to be a little more conscious of when that's happening, and just dive into the sleep routine.

Also, I'm totally letting myself off the hook for a couple of those - nights like when Bonnie told me, and the buildingenergy stuff are going to be nights when my brain keeps running. That's good, and totally cool.
fields.enough_time_in_nature_notes:
Hiking hiking hiking biking hiking :)

Started the 100 hikes this month, and absolutely loving it.  Getting on bike rides.  Craving nature, and satiating those cravings.

Lovely moment from the Nesmith point hike: "is this for appearance? for bonnie?"  later, grinning wide.. "nope. it's very definitely just for me."  Met reaches for morning.  Loved that hike.  Going on more, and really engaging with this place I live.

Getting a little mossier.
fields.healthy_activity_notes:
Every other day, staying on it, feeling great, looking great.

Did a 6 mile hike, a 30+ mile mountain bike ride, and a 10 mile 3800ft hike on back-to-back-to-back days.  Had a knot in my right leg, but other than that, was totally fine with it, and not even terribly sore.

I think that says it all.

I'm as happy with my body, strong, and healthy as I've ever been.
fields.habit_success_notes:
Hot damn, I forgot those.  But I did almost all of them perfectly!

Only things that maybe didn't happen were the occasional (aforementioned) beer sleep thing, and the off stuff.

Kick fucking ass.
fields.closer_to_two_year_plan_notes:
It's odd to say it's a 10, especially since things still feel and are tentative on the big-ticket items, but:

- Bonnie and I are going to start a family, and
- there's a job writing code on big energy issues with cool people that's a distinct possibility.

I'm also making very good progress on debt, finances are good.

In terms of progress toward that goal, it's a hard month to top.
fields.sex_life_is_good_notes:
No sex life with anyone to speak of, but still working on myself.

Some significant milestones with the "my cock wants.."   "my cock feels.." way of looking at / feeling things, but definitely fell into some old habits in terms of how I'm getting off.  Would like to get back on track with that, but it does feel like a chore sometimes.

Maybe finding some written cues, so it's more about what I imagine and feel than see?
fields.making_the_world_a_bit_better_notes:
P&G pitch went in, but not sure it really works.
GoodCloud's still rolling but super small, and without my help, really.
Facilitated for write around and volunteered, and I think that stuff genuinely counts. 

A little good, but it's not coming from my day-to-day.  Not satisfied with how that part's going.
fields.enough_time_alone_notes:
Tons of it, contiguous hours every evening, pretty much.
Things are very good in this regard, and I feel like I've got a good balance.  May be a bit high on friend + hike time taking away from downtime.  Downtime might be worth tracking, somehow.
fields.getting_out_enough_notes: Yeah, tons of time out (seeing Samsara, going to the reading with Sara), seeing friends, doing Write Around stuff.  Happy with this - if anything, I might be going out a bit too much, but I may just be pulling that from the feeling of having to run to start XY&Z prep in an hour.
fields.what_is_the_work_story_i_am_telling:
I am bored and unable to do the things I really like at Wieden, and I don't think they make the world better - and in a lot of cases, make it work.  I'm dissatisfied with my job.

I see the job I had laid out for two years from now in front of me, and I wonder if it makes sense to just take it now.
fields.presence_notes:
Pretty present, though I'm moving more into habit-zone.  I think largely, that's ok.  I'm not sure the exact balance I'm looking for, but one of the big goals really is to establish healthy habits and let my basal ganglia do the rest.

I feel like I could be a little more present and out of my head, for sure.  Those breathing exercises in the sugar lady talk were nice, grounding, placed me in the room. Want more of that.

Here.  Whole.  Me.   is a beautiful mantra, and isn't yet habit.  It works well to ground, fill, and center me.
fields.habits_from_last_month:
(Cont.)
Sleep routine
No drinking when anxious
When anxious, work out

(New)
Beer only for fun
Off every day, with a fun story/tracking
Exercise @ home harder core (bodyrock.tv?)
fields.have_a_space_that_is_just_mine_notes:
This apartment is just mine.  I also have the studio, which I never go to.

Only infringement is that I clean up my apartment when Bon comes over, and play different music.   That's something to keep an eye on.  There's being sensitive and finding the right music for the mood, and there's changing who I appear to be to fit a situation.

What I was doing was a bit of both.  Worth watching.
fields.what_is_the_relationship_story_i_am_tell: I am here, whole, me.  A good partner who is committed to the relationship, being humble, and building something beautiful and strong that lets us live an astounding life - travel, love, nature, and an astoundingly cool kid or two.
fields.finances_on_track_notes:
Hit my budget, got $2,000 from a pair of paranorman shoes and some other W+K reimbursements, and was good with them - got some nice new threads, some extra to donate to Write Around, and poured the rest into debt.

Before that, was selling random stuff to get money to donate to write around. Things feel good, and I've got enough money in the categories I'm tracking.
fields.what_is_the_identity_story_i_am_telling:
I am Steven.  I'm a man, full, whole.  I am many different things - a silly nar, an passionate flame of words, a reliable rock, a fast-moving flick.  I love love. I love making. I adore trees. I can feel strongly, think quickly and well, and be ok with things I don't do well.

I am good enough right now.  I will continue to grow, improve, and expand into the person I want to someday be.
fields.relationship_health_notes:
Really hard to answer this one in some ways, but in others, I guess it makes sense.

Bonnie and I communicate regularly with silly and support, but are really hit-and-miss with the big conversations. She's still resolving things with the other dude, so emotional communication, like I love you and <3 are all one-way now.  That's not super healthy, but it's a product of the situation.

With the "it's you", and my statements that she's got all the time she needs, I think this will slowly get better.

But bottom line, we don't yet have a stable relationship, we don't have any healthy habits, and we don't have ways of making sure we grow together, support each other in the ways we need, and each get our needs met.  Lots to do here.

We do have love, trust, some communication, and a future. That foundation is there.  In the next few months, it'll be cleaning it up, setting up some anchors, and building supports we can grow on.
fields.habits_for_next_month:
(Cont.)
Sleep routine
Find an off method that works - words? Comics?  Something to engage the imagination, make it fun, and make it sensual.
Exercise routine
Pessimism routine (plan for worst, move forward assuming best)

(New)
If things progress with Bonnie, starting to establish some relationship habits.  I expect they won't move that quickly, and that we'll have some rubble-clearing to do before building any of those.
fields.making_things_notes:
Not really enough time to do the side projects (threaded) I want, and other than some time to work on salad at work, nothing really being made there either.

PPS should be something I'm making, but I'm dragging my feet on it, partly because I don't want to do it, and partly because I don't know how.  I need to get a broader team who can write django.  Maybe it's time to recruit Chris and Martin?
fields.in_touch_with_spirtuality_notes:
I mean, what's this really mean?  I talked to a tree for a long time, made good friends.  I listened to a grove, got advice from wiggly nar friend, felt the world around me when I meditated in the mornings. 

Is that spirituality?

I'm not wholly sure exactly what I believe, or what being in touch is all about - but I do feel centered and whole. Maybe that's enough?

The saul williams show was less magic, more technique and wordsmithing - the superreal world I inhabited when I first encountered his work doesn't seem to be true anymore. Maybe that's ok.
fields.healthy_eating_notes:
Listening to my body, keeping it fed, happy, and healthy.  Dropped more body fat - look hot, and that definitely helps with the eating.  

More than that though, I just crave good real food.  In the grocery store, the yams make my mouth water.  The candy bars do not. That's a great sign.
fields.happiness_notes:
I'm catching this at the end of the month, but Bonnie just said, "basically, it's you", and there's a big opportunity (at least) in front of me with buildingenergy. That helps.

But generally, I think it's been a pretty balanced and happy month.  Went to see Jeff to start it off, spent time with friends, didn't do too much - cancelled and put things off well.  That's a biggie for me in this thing called "happiness".

I feel thankful, whole, and me.   Lucky to get to live here, now, lucky to be me.  I like this man that I am.
